		  for other purposes.

text.#text:
Since 1935, the United States has owned a
			 parcel of land in Riverside, California, consisting of approximately 9.5 acres,
			 more specifically described in

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and has been variously used for

text.#text:
The property is
			 administered by the

Since 1998, the
			 property has been administered by the

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
and the Riverside Corona Resource Conservation District,
			 which is a legal subdivision of the State of California under section 9003 of
			 the California Public Resources Code.

text.#text:
Since 2002, the property has been
			 co-managed under a cooperative agreement between the

The Conservation District wishes to acquire
			 the property and use it for conservation, environmental, and related
			 educational purposes.

As provided in this Act, the conveyance of
			 the property to the Conservation District would promote the Conservation
			 District’s conservation education and related purposes and result in savings to
			 the Federal Government.
